individual_metadata.synopsis: A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. roll amazing4. goto 5.413; 11.487; -189.1

GCB_ForbiddenRaft.synopsis: A henchman of Gekh Coal, a duergar follower of the Absolute, stops the player when he sees them interacting with a raft that'll let them progress across a lake and beyond his reach. If they haven't yet fulfilled their promise to help him, he warns them to leave the raft alone.
GCB_ForbiddenRaft.how_to_trigger: Click on Garmor or use the Raft while it is still marked as owned

Squad_Sniper.synopsis: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

DeadDuergar_Dead.synopsis: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.

Henchmen_Surprised.synopsis: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.

Squad_Wizard.synopsis: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

AD_CombatTurn_0.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn_0.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

43.speaker: Gekh Coal
43.text: You're not the gnome I'm hunting...

115.speaker: Gekh Coal
115.text: ...but a slave's a slave. Try not to fight too much. You've no use if you're damaged.

49.speaker: Gekh Coal
49.text: Too loud, sun-scum. Heard you stumbling. Can hear you blinking.

203.speaker: Narrator
203.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
203.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I'm a rabid dirty dog, and I bite.

87.speaker: Gekh Coal
87.text: Ha! A pure-bred dog of war, from that snarl. You can walk.

238.speaker: Gekh Coal
238.text: Sounds like a runt that needs putting down.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: I could've killed you before you even noticed me, but didn't. Stand down.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I follow the Absolute. Take your hand off that weapon.

109.speaker: Gekh Coal
109.text: That so? Maybe you're less useless than you look. Absolute's work needs doing right here.
109.context: NodeContext: 'Hmm. Guess I won't kill you just yet then'

263.speaker: Player
263.text: No need for violence. I do the Absolute's work.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Stand down - I'm a follower of the Absolute, just like you.

182.speaker: Gekh Coal
182.text: That so? No bad thing to have more of the Absolute's warriors to hand I suppose...
182.context: NodeContext: 'Hmm. Guess I won't kill you just yet then'

162.speaker: Gekh Coal
162.text: ... might help make shorter work of this mess...

183.speaker: Gekh Coal
183.text: That so? Show me your brand then.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

82.speaker: Player
82.text: No. You'll just have to take my word for it.

141.speaker: Gekh Coal
141.text: I take nothing I don't want to. Time you stopped sucking air.

42.speaker: Gekh Coal
42.text: Well ain't that a crying shame for you...

36.speaker: Gekh Coal
36.text: Huh. Burning those into just anyone now, are they?
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon lowered a littleNodeContext: He's discovered you're his ally, but isn't particularly impressed. Weapon lowered a little all the same

312.speaker: Gekh Coal
312.text: No harm. Every army needs grunts to run in and die first. Even the Absolute's.

146.speaker: Gekh Coal
146.text: But spoil my hunt, and you're dead.
146.context: NodeContext: A pointed finger. He isn't kidding.

314.speaker: Gekh Coal
314.text: Hunting. Slave ran away. Took Sergeant Thrinn's boots.
314.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact. Slavehunting is no big deal for him

137.speaker: Gekh Coal
137.text: Told you: hunting. Slave ran away. Took Sergeant Thrinn's boots.
137.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact. Slavehunting is no big deal for him

299.speaker: Gekh Coal
299.text: Got to kill the slave and fetch back the leather, or the bosses in Moonrise'll have Thrinn's hide.
299.context: NodeContext: It's his job. He has no moral qualms about this.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Alone. Afraid. Easily forgotten. Sounds like just my type.

125.speaker: Gekh Coal
125.text: Not as alone as we'd like.

54.speaker: Gekh Coal
54.text: Help? You don't even know what you'd be up against.

239.speaker: Gekh Coal
239.text: Slave's got herself some protection - hiding up there in a myconid circle.
239.context: NodeContext: My-con-id. Last two words spoken with a little venom.

222.speaker: Gekh Coal
222.text: I'll wait here. She'll make a run for it eventually. Then I'll get her.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: I wiped out a myconid circle and a deep gnome sheltering with them.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I already took care of the myconids and the gnome they were sheltering.

267.speaker: Gekh Coal
267.text: The whole lot? Did you find boots on that gnome?

52.speaker: Gekh Coal
52.text: Well look at that! Swift work - you could teach our slaves a thing or two.
52.context: NodeContext: Surprised/pleased (while still being true to his bitter/cynical nature)

156.speaker: Gekh Coal
156.text: You'll want to take those boots to Sergeant Thrinn in the camp across the Ebonlake.

100.speaker: Gekh Coal
100.text: I'll stay back here, see if I can find some more gnomes. A few more and I reckon I could become a True Soul.

184.speaker: Gekh Coal
184.text: If you take those boots to Sergeant Thrinn, she'll owe you.

124.speaker: Gekh Coal
124.text: Should be with the slave, or whatever's left of her. Find 'em and Sergeant Thrinn'll reward you.

265.speaker: Gekh Coal
265.text: Maybe you'll even be allowed into the Absolute's ranks.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Do you need the body intact? I like to play with my food.

284.speaker: Gekh Coal
284.text: Do what you will with the body... I couldn't care less.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: What does this runaway look like?

296.speaker: Gekh Coal
296.text: Deep gnome slave - they all look the same, but this one's got fancy boots.
296.context: NodeContext: He doesn't care. They're just livestock to him.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Who's this Sergeant Thrinn you mentioned?

56.speaker: Gekh Coal
56.text: She's with the rest of our expedition, across the lake. Special mission for the Absolute.
56.context: NodeContext: Good day's hunting re: the slaves.

139.speaker: Gekh Coal
139.text: Show you're worthy of serving the Absolute.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Would you really kill someone for a pair of boots?

281.speaker: Gekh Coal
281.text: Besides, we're talking about a slave.

277.speaker: Player
277.text: What do you need slaves for?

116.speaker: Gekh Coal
116.text: Excavation. We've got orders to clear a passage through to some ruins. There's something in there the Absolute wants.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Who or what is the Absolute?

158.speaker: Gekh Coal
158.text: My god. Going to turn the world on its head.
158.context: NodeContext: Referring to the new god he and other cultists follow.

23.speaker: Gekh Coal
23.text: Anyone who stands against Her - stands against us - is gonna wind up a slave or a corpse.

14.speaker: Gekh Coal
14.text: Good. Do well and there might be a reward for you back at camp.

71.speaker: Gekh Coal
71.text: Do really well and who knows? Maybe the Absolute'll have space for you in Her ranks.

303.speaker: Gekh Coal
303.text: But that comes later. Boots first, then you'll get what's coming to you.

308.speaker: Gekh Coal
308.text: You're either brave or stupid to be worried about your purse in these parts.

292.speaker: Gekh Coal
292.text: Get those boots, then we can talk rewards.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You'll do no such thing, slavekeeper. You die here.

266.speaker: Gekh Coal
266.text: A bleeding heart, are you? Reckon I'll just roast an' eat it.
266.context: NodeContext: Brutal and matter-of-fact. Combat ensures immediately afterwards

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Your problems are your own - I'm leaving.

152.speaker: Gekh Coal
152.text: Fine. Suppose I'll just eat you then.
152.context: NodeContext: Brutal and matter-of-fact. Combat ensures immediately afterwards

96.speaker: Player
96.text: What's the terrain ahead like - anything useful you can share?

273.speaker: Gekh Coal
273.text: Share? You really are in the wrong place, sun-scum. Try this for useful:
273.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. The player's treating him like some friendly passer-by.

112.speaker: Gekh Coal
112.text: Falling down a deep, dark hole is the kindest death you'll find in the Underdark.
112.context: NodeContext: Scornful, but there's truth here too - this isn't a nice place.

257.speaker: Player
257.text: What has you so cautious. Hook horrors? Basilisks?

154.speaker: Gekh Coal
154.text: Myconids. Those bloody walking rotflowers left half my squad dead.
154.context: NodeContext: My-con-ids. Spoken with some venom.

67.speaker: Gekh Coal
67.text: Still, got to get through them and hunt down some runaway property.

123.speaker: Gekh Coal
123.text: Didn't say you could leave, did I? Another step and you'll get a kiss off my axe.

88.speaker: Gekh Coal
88.text: Hold it. You swore an oath to the Absolute. Time to make good on it.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: I'm already on a mission for the Absolute.

289.speaker: Gekh Coal
289.text: Doesn't look like you're showering yourself in glory so far, bumbling around down here.

190.speaker: Gekh Coal
190.text: Make yourself useful, or maybe there'll be a little culling in the Absolute's ranks...

119.speaker: Player
119.text: What do you have in mind?

258.speaker: Gekh Coal
258.text: I'm on a hunt. Got a runaway slave to kill. Need to fetch back the boots she stole from Sergeant Thrinn.

117.speaker: Gekh Coal
117.text: Backstabbing swine. Absolute'll be stronger once you're dead.

252.speaker: Gekh Coal
252.text: Come on then, hookbait. I want to get this over with quick...

283.speaker: Gekh Coal
283.text: Funny. You looked like the sort to beg for mercy.
283.context: NodeContext: Unfazed by the player's move to attack him.

40.speaker: Gekh Coal
40.text: No matter. You weren't getting any.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon raised for combat immediately after.NodeContext: 'C'mon then, let's get this over with' Weapon raised for combat immediately after.

180.speaker: Narrator
180.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Stand down. I am a True Soul.

282.speaker: Gekh Coal
282.text: ... that's right. You are a True Soul.
282.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon lowered a littleNodeContext: Weapon lowered a little

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

269.speaker: Gekh Coal
269.text: Not like me to overlook one of the Absolute's Chosen. Let myself get distracted...
269.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks in the direction of this quarry - the myconid circle/injured gnome - with contemplation

148.speaker: Gekh Coal
148.context: NodeContext: The closest thing to an apology that Gekh can manage.

50.speaker: Gekh Coal
50.text: Anyway. The hunt's not over yet.

243.speaker: Gekh Coal
243.text: Thought you were here to help.

10.speaker: Gekh Coal
10.text: Tracking a runaway slave - deep gnome. Stole boots from my sergeant.

233.speaker: Gekh Coal
233.text: I'm to kill the runaway - but she's holed up with myconids.
233.context: NodeContext: My-con-ids. Spits out the word with some venom - we'll soon learn the myconids killed some of his squad.

307.speaker: Gekh Coal
307.text: Can't get past those rotflowers. They get in your head, make you see things. Half my squad jumped off a cliff, laughing.
307.context: NodeContext: Referring to psychic attacks by sentient mushrooms. Not the sort of fight he's used to.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Nothing like the sweating, shaking scent of cornered prey!

9.speaker: Gekh Coal
9.text: Oh, you're a right miserable piece of work. Let's show that whelp what the Absolute's warriors can do.

286.speaker: Gekh Coal
286.text: Bet a True Soul can make those mushrooms choke on their spores.

316.speaker: Gekh Coal
316.text: Good. Can't let some runt make fools o' the Absolute's warriors.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: I'll see what can be done - but I expect a reward.

72.speaker: Gekh Coal
72.text: Serving the Absolute ought to be reward enough. But no matter...
72.context: NodeContext: The player's request for a reward raises his eyebrow, but he lets it slide.

16.speaker: Gekh Coal
16.text: Sergeant Thrinn will cough up big to hear that slave's got her comeuppance.

121.speaker: Gekh Coal
121.text: The stolen boots will do nicely as proof. A drow such as yerself could name their prize then, I reckon.

101.speaker: Gekh Coal
101.text: The stolen boots will do nicely as proof. And a True Soul like yerself could name their prize then, I reckon.

132.speaker: Gekh Coal
132.text: I'll keep watch here. Gnome might make a run for it.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: What does this runaway look like?

66.speaker: Gekh Coal
66.text: A deep gnome with boots too good for a slave. That's all I know.
66.context: NodeContext: All slaves are the same to him. He doesn't care; he just wants to get his scalp.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: What are you doing with slaves?

86.speaker: Gekh Coal
86.text: Got 'em clearing rubble. We've got orders from Moonrise to reach some old ruins - there's something the Absolute wants, tucked away in there.

191.speaker: Gekh Coal
191.text: Not that you need me to tell you that.
191.context: NodeContext: He's assuming he's stating the obvious to a colleague

21.speaker: Player
21.text: This is your concern, not mine.

220.speaker: Gekh Coal
220.text: As you like. I guess you'll be heading to the camp across the Ebonlake.

276.speaker: Gekh Coal
276.text: Have fun with the slaves while I'm stuck here.

223.speaker: Narrator
223.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

246.speaker: Narrator
246.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

195.speaker: Narrator
195.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

208.speaker: Narrator
208.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

163.speaker: Gekh Coal
163.text: Bad enough you're making a racket. Worse that you're lying as well.
163.context: NodeContext: Brutal. He sees right through the player's lies.

310.speaker: Gekh Coal
310.text: I'll fix that. Real quick and quiet.
310.context: CinematicNodeContext: Combat immediately after this node.NodeContext: No more talk - he's going to attack the player right after this.,

255.speaker: Player
255.text: Stand down. I am a True Soul.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Take your hand off that axe before you lose it.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I'm hungry for a fight, but you're barely a morsel. Choose your next move carefully.

204.speaker: Gekh Coal
204.text: Finished flapping that mouth of yours? Good.
204.context: NodeContext: He's having none of the player's excuses.

53.speaker: Gekh Coal
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pre-combat. Weapon in plain view.NodeContext: Grim, He attacks immediately afterwards

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I can be discreet. No need for bloodshed.

47.speaker: Gekh Coal
47.text: Sooner I get rid of this one, the sooner I can get back to doing the Absolute's work...
47.context: NodeContext: Gekh's internal thoughts. Voiced but no lipsync.

251.speaker: Gekh Coal
251.text: Clumsy, sun-scum. I felt you, fumbling about in my head. You'll pay for that.
251.context: NodeContext: Caught the player in the act (attempted mind reading)

31.speaker: Player
31.text: I'm a duergar, idiot - we're practically kin.

171.speaker: Gekh Coal
171.text: Any kin of mine ought to have more sense moving through the Underdark.

134.speaker: Gekh Coal
134.text: But your blood earns you one more chance. Got enough on my plate as it is.
134.context: NodeContext: Letting the player off the hook. For now.

295.speaker: Player
295.text: Try, if you like. We'll see who gets hushed.

65.speaker: Gekh Coal
65.text: Oh we'll see. Have no fear of that.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: Fights tend to make quite a racket, if that's what you want to avoid.

185.speaker: Gekh Coal
185.text: Hrrm. I suppose the sound of me cracking your nut would carry down here...

92.speaker: Gekh Coal
92.text: You're a liability, hook-bait. I'll decide how many steps and breaths you've got left.
92.context: NodeContext: 'One more step, and you're dead'. Hook-bait refers to a hook horrors - a species of predatory beast in the underdark, which might be attracted by the player's noise.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand doesn't need to have attention drawn to it.

205.speaker: Gekh Coal
205.text: Noise gets you eaten down here. Reckon I'll hush you, before something hungry comes along.
205.context: NodeContext: A grim statement of fact. He intends to kill you rather than let you bumble around.

61.speaker: Gekh Coal
61.text: Now you're a boat thief if I ever saw one. But nice of you to come back, so I can split your skull.
61.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous that the player (and likely boat thief) has returned to the scene of the crime. Combat ensues after this.

75.speaker: Gekh Coal
75.text: Well? You done mucking about yet?

94.speaker: Gekh Coal
94.text: Nothing for you here. Cross the Ebonlake to the sergeant. Or drown in it for all I care.

103.speaker: Gekh Coal
103.text: Get the leather. I ain't wasting more words on you until it's done.

128.speaker: Gekh Coal
128.text: What a hunt. Maybe you'll find a belt next.

298.speaker: Gekh Coal
298.text: Right, I'll mop up here. You get across the Ebonlake - find Sergeant Thrinn. She'll reward you.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What's on the other side of the lake?

280.speaker: Gekh Coal
280.text: Squad of my kin camping in some ruins. Pack of gnome slaves there, too.

33.speaker: Gekh Coal
33.text: We're using 'em for excavation. There's some more ruins Moonrise wants us to make a path to - there's something hidden in 'em. Something the Absolute wants.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: How will I recognise Sergeant Thrinn?

74.speaker: Gekh Coal
74.text: Not too sharp, are you? Look for a duergar with a sour mug and bare feet.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: What does the runaway look like?

279.speaker: Gekh Coal
279.text: What part of 'not wasting words' didn't penetrate your skull?

97.speaker: Gekh Coal
97.text: She's a deep gnome slave with fancy boots - the only one down here.

3.speaker: Gekh Coal
3.text: Huh. So that's how it's going to be.

161.speaker: Gekh Coal
161.text: Time you got across the Ebonlake, True Soul. Nothing more to be done on this side.

181.speaker: Gekh Coal
181.text: Both True Soul and drow - that slave'd jump off a ledge if she knew who was after her.

188.speaker: Gekh Coal
188.text: You're not sun-scum. You should know not to make that much noise.

28.speaker: Gekh Coal
28.text: Right then. Let's get you out of the way.

236.speaker: Gekh Coal
236.text: Wasn't expecting one of you drow to join the hunt... Praise the Absolute.
236.context: NodeContext: A little more deference shown. The player is a drow; typically a higher-ranked cultist.

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Absolute...? I don't know what you mean.

113.speaker: Gekh Coal
113.text: ...Huh. Absolute's teachings say that anyone who doesn't bow to Her is the enemy.
113.context: NodeContext: Mild surprise. The player just freely admitted they're no ally of his. He's free to attack.

241.speaker: Gekh Coal
241.context: NodeContext: Combat ensues immedialtely after this.

227.speaker: Gekh Coal
227.text: Well then, drow or not... I reckon I don't have to answer to you.
227.context: NodeContext: Mild surprise. The player just freely admitted they're no ally of his. He's free to attack.

278.speaker: Gekh Coal
278.text: In fact, if you ain't with the Absolute, I reckon you're more like the enemy.
278.context: NodeContext: Weapon raised. Combat ensues immedialtely after this.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: I'm here at the Absolute's bidding. That's all you need to know.

248.speaker: Gekh Coal
248.context: NodeContext: Backing down a little. Hand off weapon

275.speaker: Gekh Coal
275.text: Especially if you don't have a brand. Ought to see to that... all due respect.

98.speaker: Gekh Coal
98.text: I ain't the sort to question a drow... but that was the rottenest lie to ever meet my ears.
98.context: NodeContext: Calling out the player's lie.

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Show some respect - I am a True Soul.

206.speaker: Gekh Coal
206.text: A True Soul... yes. Should've seen it right away.
206.context: NodeContext: 'Oh yes, of course you're right'. He's just been psychically influenced by the player and says this line in a slightly dazed, entranced manner.

304.speaker: Narrator
304.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

291.speaker: Narrator
291.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

297.speaker: Narrator
297.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

104.speaker: Gekh Coal
104.context: NodeContext: He's paying deference to the player now, but only ever so slightly. He's still gruff and grim.

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

175.speaker: Player
175.text: Show some respect - I am a True Soul.

35.speaker: Gekh Coal
35.text: No... something's wrong. You're no True Soul.

136.speaker: Gekh Coal
136.text: And if you ain't who you say you are, I reckon you're fair game.

259.speaker: Narrator
259.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

237.speaker: Gekh Coal
237.text: You got a bloody rotflower for company? Must've let it get in your head. My axe'll fix that in no time...
237.context: NodeContext: Aggressive - the player's got a hostile lifeform accompanying them.

244.speaker: Gekh Coal
244.text: What's this? Got ourselves an infiltrator?

313.speaker: Gekh Coal
313.text: You drow can be light on your feet. Must've been why you were sent to join the hunt... Praise the Absolute.

290.speaker: Gekh Coal
290.text: You move pretty quietly. Not quietly enough for my liking, though.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: I dealt with the escapee and the myconids sheltering her.

232.speaker: Gekh Coal
232.text: Good - and  good riddance. You'd best have proof though - Thrinn will want more than just your word.

48.speaker: Gekh Coal
48.text: Not that it's all too smart to question a drow and a True Soul, mind you.
48.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging that the player appears to be his superior on two scores

27.speaker: Gekh Coal
27.text: Not that it's all too smart to question a True Soul.
27.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging that the player appears to be his superior

270.speaker: Player
270.text: I've done as you asked - I have the boots.

315.speaker: Gekh Coal
315.text: You'll want to take those to Sergeant Thrinn - in the camp.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: What's on the other side of the lake?

173.speaker: Gekh Coal
173.text: More like us. And a bunch of gnome slaves.

294.speaker: Gekh Coal
294.text: Got them moving rubble. Need to clear a path through to some ruins. The Absolute wants something tucked away in there, and we're to find it.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: How will I recognise Sergeant Thrinn?

293.speaker: Gekh Coal
293.text: Look for a duergar with bare feet and a face like thunder. You can't miss her.
293.context: NodeContext: Almost cracks a grin here. Amused at the idea of his superior being pissed off.,

317.speaker: Gekh Coal
317.text: I'll stay back here, see if I can find some more gnomes. A few more and I reckon I could become a True Soul.

95.speaker: Gekh Coal
95.text: She's just some deep gnome slave. They all look much the same to me.
95.context: NodeContext: The slave is nothing more than livestock to him,

11.speaker: Gekh Coal
11.text: The boots should give her away.

131.speaker: Gekh Coal
131.text: Could've tried that before. Saved me some time.
131.context: NodeContext: Understated anger as the player betrays him. Combat ensues after this.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_4.speaker: Player
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_4.text: I've got a pair of boots to return.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_0.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_0.text: Could've told me that before. Go ahead.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_11.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_11.text: Well you've looked. Now keep away from that raft until I say otherwise.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_10.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_10.text: Speak for yourself - I've got plenty of harm intended.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_5.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_5.text: Saw you, making off with our boat. You should've stayed away, sun-scum.
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_5.context: NodeContext: Confrontational, believing the player stole the duergar's boat. Combat ensues afterwards

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_6.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_6.text: Gekh does the talking around here - bother him.

GCB_ForbiddenRaft_7.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft_7.text: Told you to keep away from there, didn't I?

Squad_Sniper_0.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper_0.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

Squad_Sniper_2.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper_2.text: Half the squad dead for the sake of one runaway. Gh'rack.
Squad_Sniper_2.context: NodeContext: Gh'rack pronounced GRACK. Means 'damn it' in Undercommon.

Squad_Sniper_3.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper_3.text: If you need attention, see Gekh.

DeadDuergar_Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
DeadDuergar_Dead_1.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DeadDuergar_Dead_5.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead_5.text: Hunter... reaver... warrior of... the Absolute...

DeadDuergar_Dead_17.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead_17.text: Me... no. Gnomes... were fiddling... with rubble... yonder.

DeadDuergar_Dead_16.speaker: Player
DeadDuergar_Dead_16.text: What were you doing when you died?

DeadDuergar_Dead_18.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead_18.text: Hunter... warrior... sworn to... the Absolute...

DeadDuergar_Dead_2.speaker: Narrator
DeadDuergar_Dead_2.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

DeadDuergar_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
DeadDuergar_Dead_21.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Henchmen_Surprised_2.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Henchmen_Surprised_0.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised_0.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn_0.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn_0.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Wizard_0.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard_0.text: You'll want to speak to Gekh. He's in charge.
Squad_Wizard_0.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

Squad_Wizard_1.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard_1.text: Gekh's the talker, not me. Back off.

Squad_Wizard_2.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Wizard_2.context: NodeContext: Respectful towards a drow player.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn_0.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn_0.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!
